relations.Description: Biofuel is a type of carbon-neutral fuel that is produced from renewable sources such as plants, algae, or organic waste. It can be used as a substitute for conventional fossil fuels in transportation and energy generation.
relations.Subject: biofuel

relations.Description: Hydrogen fuel is a form of carbon-neutral fuel that is produced by splitting water molecules through electrolysis. It can be used in fuel cells to generate electricity or as a clean energy source for various applications.
relations.Subject: hydrogen fuel

relations.Description: Synthetic fuel, also known as carbon-neutral synthetic fuel, is a type of fuel that is produced from renewable energy sources and carbon dioxide captured from the atmosphere. It can be used as a substitute for conventional fossil fuels in transportation and energy production.
relations.Subject: synthetic fuel

relations.Description: Electricity is a form of carbon-neutral energy that can be generated from renewable sources such as solar, wind, hydro, or geothermal power. It can be used as a clean energy source for various applications, including transportation and heating.
relations.Subject: electricity

relations.Description: Methane, also known as biogas, is a type of carbon-neutral fuel that is produced from organic waste, agricultural residues, or landfill gas. It can be used as a substitute for natural gas in heating, cooking, and electricity generation.
relations.Subject: methane
